code: @Manual{,   title = {ourproj: Our Datascience Project Workflow},   author = {Alasdair Warwick and Abraham {Olvera Barrios}},   year = {2023},   note = {https://rmgpanw.github.io/ourproj/, https://github.com/rmgpanw/ourproj}, }

title: Our Datascience Project Workflow
text: goal ourproj provide data science project template combines workflowr quarto targets. Analyses organised research website, can viewed locally also easily deployed either GitHub Pages GitLab Pages.

title: Our Datascience Project Workflow
text: can install development version ourproj GitHub :

title: Our Datascience Project Workflow
text: Create new project either RStudio new project wizard R console ourproj::ourproj_start(). Install required R packages renv::init(). Run targets pipeline targets::tar_make(). generate workflowr research website either docs public directory (GitHub GitLab Pages respectively), may viewed locally double clicking index.html file browser. Add workflowr rmarkdown analyses analysis folder (template provided, available RStudio new rmarkdown wizard). automatically tracked targets pipeline. Re-run analysis pipeline targets::tar_make().
code: library(ourproj) # create a new project ourproj_start(directory = "~/NEW_PROJECT_DIR",               project_title = "My project",                git_username = "My git username",                github_gitlab = "github",                template = "workflowr_targets_minimal")  # use renv to install required R packages renv::init()  # run targets pipeline targets::tar_make()

title: Our Datascience Project Workflow
text: workflowr_targets_minimal workflowr_targets quarto_website_targets

what: Start a new workflowr/targets project — ourproj_start
title: Start a new workflowr/targets project — ourproj_start
text: Creates directory essential files workflowr quarto project, using GitHub/Gitlab Pages targets data analysis pipeline.

title: Start a new workflowr/targets project — ourproj_start
code: ourproj_start(   directory,   project_title,   git_username,   github_gitlab = "gitlab",   template = "workflowr_targets_minimal" )

title: Start a new workflowr/targets project — ourproj_start
text: directory character. directory new project created, e.g. "~/myproj". error raised directory already exists. project_title character. title project. git_username character. GitHub/GitLab user name. github_gitlab character. Either 'github' 'gitlab' template Project template used. Options: 'workflowr_targets_minimal', 'workflowr_targets', 'quarto_website_targets'.

title: Start a new workflowr/targets project — ourproj_start
text: directory invisibly.

title: Start a new workflowr/targets project — ourproj_start
text: Examples available project templates: workflowr_targets_minimal workflowr_targets quarto_website_targets

title: Start a new workflowr/targets project — ourproj_start
code: if (FALSE) {  ourproj_start(    directory = tempdir(),    project_title = "My Project",    git_username = "user"  ) }

what: Target factory for workflowr R markdown reports. — tar_render_workflowr
title: Target factory for workflowr R markdown reports. — tar_render_workflowr
text: Generates list target objects render multiple workflowr R markdown reports.

title: Target factory for workflowr R markdown reports. — tar_render_workflowr
code: tar_render_workflowr(   include = NULL,   exclude = NULL,   include_pattern = NULL,   exclude_pattern = "^_",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Target factory for workflowr R markdown reports. — tar_render_workflowr
text: include Optional character vector .Rmd files rendered. exclude Optional character vector .Rmd files excluded. include_pattern default, include .Rmd files workflowr_dir. exclude_pattern default, exclude files names prefixed "_". verbose TRUE, prints message listing .Rmd files targets created. Also passed workflowr::wflow_build().

title: Target factory for workflowr R markdown reports. — tar_render_workflowr
text: list target objects format = 'file', one workflowr report.

title: Target factory for workflowr R markdown reports. — tar_render_workflowr

title: Target factory for pipeline input files — tar_track_input_files
code: # dummy input file to create target for DATA_IN_PATH <- tempfile(fileext = ".txt") file.create(DATA_IN_PATH) #> [1] TRUE  # create target for this with `format = "file"` tar_track_input_files() #> named list()
